Comment 3: 
It basically means that the Git repo will have to have two branches: a pristine clone of
the Mercurial branch and a "with gitignore" branch. Every time the Git repo's updated,
the pristine clone is merged into the "with gitignore" branch, creating a merge commit.

The other alternative is to just tell everyone using Git to list ignore files in
.git/info/exclude, which is totally manual and isn't tracked by Git.
